intro: Ocalia sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Ocalia sellowiana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
